title: Cyclone 'Vayu' Expected to Hit Kerala Coast
description: The IMD has issued a Cyclone Red Alert as Cyclone 'Vayu' is expected to make landfall near Thiruvananthapuram with wind speeds of 90-110 km/h. Fishermen are strictly advised not to venture into the sea. Coastal evacuations are being planned.

title: Severe Flooding Reported in Kuttanad Region
description: The Kuttanad region in Alappuzha is experiencing severe flooding due to rising water levels in the Pamba and Manimala rivers. Evacuation of low-lying areas is advised. Relief camps are being set up. More information would be passed through SMS.

title: Moderate Rainfall Predicted for Kozhikode
description: IMD predicts moderate rainfall of 64.5 mm to 115.5 mm in Kozhikode district. Residents are advised to remain cautious, especially in hilly regions prone to landslides.

title: Heavy Rainfall Expected in Ernakulam
description: IMD has issued a Red Alert for Ernakulam district due to the possibility of extremely heavy rainfall exceeding 204.4 mm. Residents are advised to stay indoors and avoid unnecessary travel.
